cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 255 miles SSE of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to drift NNW today, turn WNW on Sunday–Monday across or near the Yucatán Channel, then accelerate northward through the central Gulf of Mexico toward the northern Gulf Coast (Louisiana/Mississippi) Tuesday night–Wednesday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern Louisiana coast (between Morgan City and the Mississippi River delta)

port.name: Port of Greater Baton Rouge, LA

weather_observation.watch_coast: Pinar del Río Province, western Cuba
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from the upper Texas coast eastward across Louisiana, Mississippi, Alabama, and the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (35–45 mph) are possible at the port late Wednesday into early Thursday; chance of 50-kt winds is low (≤4%).
weather_observation.storm_surge: Only minor river surge (≤3 ft) could propagate up the lower Mississippi; significant coastal surge is expected farther south near the delta.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–6 inches of rainfall possible Wednesday–Thursday with localized higher amounts, producing flash-flood risk and river rises along the Mississippi.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes in outer rainbands and debris-flow or bank instability along the Mississippi River are possible during peak winds and heavy rain.
